intro: Ceropegia eilensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Ceropegia eilensis thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
